column5: Sorry to tease you guys looking forward to opener but went back to Eagle Lake after taking a half day off work as a last minute decision. My buddy came along...we got a limit, a few swapped up and not as big as the other day but fish for supper...cant be beat.Another good thing is my I-pilot arrived and it worked seamlessly! Locking on the spot and just fishing is amazing, i still dont trust it even though it held us withing inches of our spot all afternoon. All this effortless fishing will take a little while to adjust to.I now have the lock spot function figured out and am getting to like the Advanced auto-pilot feature (auto-pilot with GPS assist). We had fun saving a lock spot...moving a few hundred yards away then making the boat find it...cool. Next time out i am gonna familiarise myself with recording tracks....will be awesome on a few weedlines i know when the weeds arrive.TODAY'S VIDEOhttp://www.youtube.com/embed/nAT9yPUgc44IF YOU HAVE A MINN_KOTA.......GET AN I-PILOThttp://i907.photobucket.com/albums/a...r/IMG_1369.jpgGOT SUPPERhttp://i907.photobucket.com/albums/a...IMG_1373-1.jpg

Awesome job Limey, some nice fish there! I did pretty good yesterday for only fishing for 2 hours, no big girls though. Season close is coming quick man! What are we gonna do then? haha, we've truly been spoiled this year. Awesome to hear the I-pilot works good, sounds like it will help you catch more fish this year (which kinda sounds funny) thanks for the report
Ok Limey, enough is enough, I can't take much more. I've got 155 days before I wet a line up there. Please be gentle!! Nice fish!!!
Ha ha Terry, as of tomorrow it will be only 86 day's.But yes I will agree you guy's are killin us watching the video's
Simon, where did you end up getting your ipilot from?

Online ...Ebay, not much cheaper than cabelas.....but i'm tired of Canadian stuff costing way more just cuz we will pay it...saved about 20 bucks in the end. Means i will have to go direct through Minkota for the warranty thoiugh.
